title_sort: edward p. cattell to walt whitman, 21 october 1877
title: Edward P. Cattell to Walt Whitman, 21 October 1877
text: Sunday 21thold man i got your kind and welcom[welcome] letter last week and was glad to hear from you my loving old friend i love to hear from you and to know that you ar[are] well and i would Com[come] up to see you But i cant[can't] get of[off] a day now for we ar[are] so Bisse[busy] now husking corn i went with some Boys up the Pond to day[today] and i seen your old Chir floting[floating] down the stream Then went up to the house to gorge Stafford[George Stafford] then seen herbert gillchrist[Herbert Gilchrist] and all of georges[George's] folks. i Would like to Com[come] up to town i think of you old man think of the times down on the Crieek[Creek]. i did want to Com[come] up to Camden on Wensday[Wednesday] to G. B. But i Cant[can't] get of[off] i hop[hope] next Summer we will Be togearter[together] more then we was thisMay this find you well as i am so gooddear walt i wont Com[come] up to town next Sat day[Saturday]. or Sat day[Saturday] week and i would like to see you and have a talk i love you Walt and all ways[always] will so may god Bless youis my prayer from of your frend[friend]Edward P CattellKirkwoodCamdenCountyNew Jersy[Jersey] Edward P. Cattell to Walt Whitman, 21 October 1877
